page.title: 01Summary
page.content: Most of this area is farmland with a few scattered farmhouses.The large farms on the Ogbourne downs are arable but the farm in the village is a dairy farm. Another large area is taken by a golf course where local people work.Most golf club members live 10 miles away in Swindon. You get lovely views from the top of the Ogbourne downs.The weather is often dry,cool and windy. The south-east part of the village has a busy cafe,2 pubs,a garage,and a village store.These places are used by hikers walking the Ridgeway,by lorry drivers and travellers using the busy main road, and by the local people as well.
